docs.lead_paragraph: Medicare and the Affordable Care Act took center stage at stops in Ohio and Iowa.

headline.seo: Obama and Ryan Talk Health Care at Campaign Stops
headline.main: Health Care Leads Campaign Dialogue in Midwest
headline.print_headline: Health Care Leads Campaign Dialogue in Midwest

docs.abstract: President Barack Obama, on the last day of his three-day bus tour of Iowa, sharply attacks Mitt Romney and his running mate Paul D Ryan for advocating budget cuts that he said would curtail Medicare benefits.
docs.snippet: Medicare and the Affordable Care Act took center stage at stops in Ohio and Iowa.

byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel contributed reporting from Oxford, Ohio.

docs.lead_paragraph: For both contenders in the presidential race, winning over the small group of undecided voters seems less important than appealing to the base.

headline.seo: Ryan Pick Shifts Focus From Economy to Ideology
headline.main: Choice of Paul Ryan Shifts the Focus From Economy to Ideology
headline.print_headline: Choice of Ryan Shifts the Focus From Economy

docs.abstract: Political Memo on Mitt Romney's selection of Rep Paul D Ryan as his running mate, which has energized the Republican Party’s base and brought fresh enthusiasm and bigger crowds to the Romney campaign; choice is evidence of a subtle but broad strategic shift by Romney toward a focus on energizing an anti-Obama campaign that many Congressional Republicans are concerned could divert attention from core issues.
docs.snippet: For both contenders in the presidential race, winning over the small group of undecided voters seems less important than appealing to the base.

docs.lead_paragraph: Municipal bonds are widely seen as one of the safest investments, but this belief is based on records for a narrow slice of the market, according to new research.

headline.seo: Municipal Bonds Default More Than Advertised
headline.main: Muni Bonds Not as Safe as Thought
headline.print_headline: Muni Bonds Not as Safe As Thought

docs.abstract: Federal Reserve Bank of New York research finds that municipal bonds are widely seen as one of the safest investments, but this belief is based on records for a narrow slice of the market; finds much broader sample, which includes unrated bonds, had about 36 times as many municipal defaults over the past 40 years as conventional wisdom suggests.
docs.snippet: Municipal bonds are widely seen as one of the safest investments, but this belief is based on records for a narrow slice of the market, according to new research.

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: We are learning so much about Paul Ryan, people! But what will this all mean to the American health care system?
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column considers what the selection of Paul D Ryan as Mitt Romney's running mate will mean for the American health care system, particularly Medicare.
docs.snippet: We are learning so much about Paul Ryan, people! But what will this all mean to the American health care system?

docs.lead_paragraph: The accord would end a three-and-a-half-month walkout in Joliet, Ill., but local union leaders called for its rejection.

headline.main: Ratification of Union’s Deal With Caterpillar May Face Difficulties
headline.print_headline: Tentative Pact Reached In Strike at Caterpillar

docs.abstract: Caterpillar and the International Association of Machinists reach a tentative six-year settlement that could end a three-and-a-half-month strike at the company's plant in Joliet, Ill., but local union leaders are calling for its rejection.
docs.snippet: The accord would end a three-and-a-half-month walkout in Joliet, Ill., but local union leaders called for its rejection.

docs.abstract: The president, aides said, will use the last day of a three-day bus tour of Iowa to take on Mitt Romney and his running mate, Paul D. Ryan, over the health care program for older Americans.
docs.snippet: The president, aides said, will use the last day of a three-day bus tour of Iowa to take on Mitt Romney and his running mate, Paul D. Ryan, over the health care program for older Americans.

headline.main: The Truth Has A Well-Known Demagogic Bias

docs.abstract: And so it must not be acknowledged.

docs.lead_paragraph: A fight over the health care program for older Americans is intensifying in House and Senate races after Representative Paul D. Ryan’s selection as Mitt Romney’s running mate.

headline.seo: With Ryan In, Medicare Fight Recasts Races for Congress
headline.main: Two-Way Jabs on Medicare Recast Races for Congress
headline.print_headline: Medicare Fight Recasts Races For Congress

docs.abstract: Fight over Medicare, the health care program for older Americans, is intensifying in House and Senate races after Rep Paul D Ryan’s selection as the Republican vice-presidential candidate; Congressional Democrats and some analysts say the development could transform the fight for control of Congress, given his role as the author of a House-approved budget plan that would reshape Medicare.
docs.snippet: A fight over the health care program for older Americans is intensifying in House and Senate races after Representative Paul D. Ryan’s selection as Mitt Romney’s running mate.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear and Sarah Wheaton contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: The partisan brawl over the program continued on Tuesday and threatened to become the focus of the presidential race.

headline.seo: Battle Over Medicare Savings Intensifies Between Obama and Paul Ryan
headline.main: Obama-Ryan Battle Intensifies Over Medicare Savings
headline.print_headline: Obama-Ryan Battle Intensifies Over Medicare Savings

docs.snippet: The partisan brawl over the program continued on Tuesday and threatened to become the focus of the presidential race.
